revised_title: K I Absorption Spectrum: 2p-Subshell Excitation in Vacuum Ultraviolet
tldr: The authors studied the KI absorption spectrum in the vacuum ultraviolet range and discovered eight discrete features due to excitation from the 2p subshell. They compared their findings with Hartree-Fock calculations to provide a detailed interpretation of the observed spectrum. The strong doublet lines in the spectrum were found to be broad, with autoionization broadening being a major contributor to their widths.
